title: CBC Radio
text:
Woodstock, Ontario's Greg Morton charmed celebrity judges on America's Got Talent and captivated the live audience week after week with his uncanny vocal impressions. The veteran comedian has spent decades performing stand-up comedy across North America but delighted new audiences this year as he made it to the reality competition show's semi-finals.

Morton joins q host Tom Power live in studio to explore how his TV stint has expanded his stand-up set and how a lifelong love of characters and comedy has propelled him into a dream career.

The comedian returns for a tour across southern Ontario. You can catch his one-man variety show on Oct. 8 in London, Ontario at the Wold Performance Hall, Oct. 9 in Guelph and Oct. 10 in Oshawa.

— Produced by ​Emma Godmere

*The full audio will be added to this post following the broadcast.
description: Greg Morton is returning home to southern Ontario for a tour following a huge stint on TV BECAUSE he's figuring out how to balance two of his many talents: stand-up comedy and incredible vocal impressions
